name: _til_html__form-element-enter.md
content:
# Submit inside Form Element

The input elements inside a form element would automatically trigger a submit action when pressed the enter key. Kind of obvious but there certainly have been times where I implemented a onKeyDown event on the input elements.

name: _til_js__btoa.md
content:
# Base64 Encoding and Decoding

btoa() function in the browser context allows you to encode ASCII string in base-64. Pretty neat to have a very accessible function that allows for creating unique values from a given string but apperantly this function is not suitable to be used on Unicode strings. You can use the atob() function to decode the base-64 encoded string.

More information is at this [mdn page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/API/WindowBase64/Base64_encoding_and_decoding)

name: _til_react__dangerouslySet.md
content:
# Using Raw HTML in React

In React, if you wanted to directly use HTML text as a content, you need to use the attribute called "dangerouslySetInnerHTML". It can be used like this:

```
<div dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{__html: sanitized_string }}
```

Notice that this attribute needs to be passed an object with a key **__html** . Useful if you are using a library like 'marked' that would be compile markdown to the html on the fly. Be careful with this attribute though, the name doesn't sound threatening for no reason.
